title: SoC RTVF 398-0-22 Symposium: Issues in RTVF

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is a performance class. In this class, students will learn the skills improvisers use to success in the film and television industry with a focus on character. The goal of the class is to gain a deeper understanding of how characters are revealed on stage and screen and how other characters move in relationship with them to build story. In the second part of the class we will attempt to improvise the hero's journey. The class will attend an improv performance in Chicago.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be graded on participation, collaboration and understanding of concepts learned, as well as tests on reading materials, a midterm, homework and an improvised long-form final. Students are required to see an improv show.
